meanings.definition: To cover or wrap with a shawl.
meanings.sent1: She was shawling herself before going out in the cold.
meanings.sent2: I saw her shawling her shoulders with a cozy shawl.
meanings.sent3: The cat was shawling itself in a tiny blanket, pretending to be a queen.
meanings.sent4: The fog shawled the city, hiding its tall buildings from view.
meanings.sent5: The mother shawled her baby in a soft, warm blanket to protect him from the chilly wind.

meanings.definition: The act of wearing or using a shawl.
meanings.sent1: Her shawling of the elegant shawl caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The shawling of the shawl added a touch of sophistication to her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The shawling of the shawl made her feel like a character from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: The shawling of the shawl around her shoulders transformed her into a graceful lady.
meanings.sent5: The shawling of the shawl around her was a symbol of her elegance and grace.

meanings.definition: The material used to make a shawl.
meanings.sent1: The soft shawling of the fabric made it perfect for a cozy shawl.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate shawling of the yarn used in the shawl.
meanings.sent3: The colorful shawling of the threads reminded her of a beautiful rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The delicate shawling of the material created a stunning shawl.
meanings.sent5: The luxurious shawling of the wool made the shawl feel incredibly soft and warm.
